00028 Text::Text (string content) : content_(content), proportionality_(FONT_PROPORTIONAL), wordRates_(vector<WordRate>(0))
00029 {
00030     // Initialize the vector of styles according to the number of characters in the content

00075 void Text::addCharacter (char character, Style style, unsigned int position)
00076 {
00077     // The desired position exceeds the content length, so we append to the of the text
00078     if(position > getLength())
00079     {
00080         content_ += character;
00081         styles_.push_back(style);
00082     }
00083     else
00084     {
00085         // Check for a valid position, though a compiler should use a big value when a negative
00086         // number is assigned to an unsigned int
00087         if (position < 0)
00088         {
00089             position = 0;
00090         }
00091                 
00092         // Declare two iterators for pointing to the desired position
00093         string::iterator contentIterator        = content_.begin();
00094         vector<Style>::iterator stylesIterator  = styles_.begin();
00095         
00096         // Advance the iterators until the desired position
00097         while (position > 1)
00098         {
00099             ++contentIterator;
00100             ++stylesIterator;
00101 
00102             --position;
00103         }
00104         
00105         // Insert the character and its style
00106         content_.insert(contentIterator, character);
00107         styles_.insert(stylesIterator, style);
00108     }
00109     
00110     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00111     computeWordRates();
00112 };

00129     }
00130

00132     addCharacter(character, Style(), position);

00171 void Text::removeCharacter (unsigned int position)
00172 {
00173     // Check for a valid position
00174     if (position > getLength())
00175     {
00176         position = getLength();
00177     }
00178     
00179     // Declare two iterators for pointing to the desired character and its style
00180     string::iterator contentIterator        = content_.begin();
00181     vector<Style>::iterator stylesIterator  = styles_.begin();
00182     
00183     // Advance the iterators until the desired position
00184     while (position > 1)
00185     {
00186         ++contentIterator;
00187         ++stylesIterator;
00188         
00189         --position;
00190     }
00191     
00192     // Remove the character and its style
00193     content_.erase(contentIterator);
00194     styles_.erase(stylesIterator);
00195     
00196     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00197     computeWordRates();
00198 };

00211 Style Text::getCharacterStyle (unsigned int position) const
00212 {
00213     if (position >= getLength())
00214         return Style();
00215     else
00216         return styles_[position];
00217 };

00336 void Text::updateWordRate (string word)
00337 {
00338     // Searches the word in the vector
00339     vector<WordRate>::iterator wordRates;
00340     for (wordRates = wordRates_.begin(); wordRates != wordRates_.end(); ++wordRates)
00341     {
00342         // Updates its appearance rate
00343         if ( (*wordRates).first == word )
00344         {
00345             (*wordRates).second++;
00346             return;
00347         }
00348     }
00349     
00350     // The word was not stored, so here we adds its first appearance
00351     wordRates_.push_back(WordRate(word, 1));
00352 };
00353 
00354 
00363 void Text::computeWordRates ()
00364 {   
00365     vector<string> words;   // Vector to hold our words after removing spaces
00366     
00367     // Extract the words in text
00368     tokenize(words);
00369     
00370     // Update appearance rate of every word extracted
00371     vector<string>::iterator wordsIterator;
00372     for (wordsIterator = words.begin(); wordsIterator != words.end(); ++wordsIterator)
00373         updateWordRate(*wordsIterator);
00374         
00375     // This sorting will improve future lookups
00376     sort (wordRates_.begin(), wordRates_.end());
00377 };
00378 
00379 
00384 void Text::tokenize(vector<string>& tokens, const string& delimiters) const
00385 {
00386     // Skip delimiters at the beginning of text
00387     string::size_type lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, 0);
00388     
00389     // Find the first "non-delimiter"
00390     string::size_type pos     = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00391     
00392     // Traverse the content until reaching its end
00393     while (string::npos != pos || string::npos != lastPos)
00394     {
00395         // A word has been found, add it to the vector
00396         tokens.push_back(content_.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos));
00397         
00398         // Skip delimiters again
00399         lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, pos);
00400         
00401         // Find the next "non-delimiter"
00402         pos = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00403     }
00404 };
